definition: to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall

sentences.english: This would allow retailers to trace the meat to back to a cloned source.
sentences.chinese: 這也能使零售商追述到肉製品的克隆來源。

sentences.english: The reason why the mining trip, thanks to a 88-year-old man recalled.
sentences.chinese: 此次挖掘之所以成行，得益於一名88歲老人的追述。

sentences.english: This custom of climbing mountains can be dated back as early as West Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 登山的風俗可以追述到很早的西漢時期。

sentences.english: Faulkner traces the history of the Compson family.
sentences.chinese: 福克納追述了康普生家史。

sentences.english: We can trace the development of their religious belief.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以追述他們的宗教信仰的發展。

definition: lit. to go upstream/to trace sth back to/to date from
to recount what happened prior to events already known
evolution of sth over time/course of development/history
to recall/to bring to mind/to reminisce
to trace sth back to its origin
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
to pursue sth back to its origins/to trace back to the source/to get to the bottom of sth
